sentence.text: Spinocerebellar ataxia type 3 (SCA3) is a neurodegenerative disorder caused by a CAG expansion in the protein K63-linked deubiquitination gene leading to a polyglutamine expansion in the ataxin-3 protein.
Furthermore, NLS-bearing protein import into nucleus knockout in SCA3 mice resulted in an amelioration of molecular and behavioral disturbances such as total activity, anxiety, and gait.
